results.title: Wildlife ranger
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Don Murray and David Haythornthwaite
results.brief_description: An insight into the difficulties faced in the daily lives of two rangers in Kakadu National Park, in the Northern Territory. The park is remote and supplies and news must come via mail plane from Darwin.. Also includes wonderful footage of Australia’s unique scenery and wildlife.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Film Australia, Don Murray and David Haythornthwaite

results.title: Wildlife of the Rocky Mountains
results.brief_description: After many years of careful conservation, Banff and Jasper National Parks have become vast zoological gardens. In this film you see many intimate views of the creatures of the wild, big and small, that inhabit the forested mountain slopes of these parks. Deer, moose, bear, big-horn sheep, birds and small animals that live above the tree-line are natural subjects for the close-up camera, shooting against a backdrop of snowy peaks of the Canadian Rockies.

results.title: Wildlife of the River Valley
results.brief_description: A program that presents a unique view of the enormous variety of wildlife that lives in the Bellinger River Valley, situated halfway between Sydney and Brisbane on the east coast of Australia. This is a brightly paced, entertaining and informative documentary that can be enjoyed by audiences of all ages.

results.title: Wildlife of the Mountains
results.brief_description: The wild life to be found in the spectacular mountain landscape of the Waitaki water-shed in the South Island of New Zealand. Alpine flowers, native birds, and their nests, deer and fawns, the salmon coming up the river to spawn are among the beautiful creatures in this wild and isolated area.

results.title: Wildlife in the jungles of Latin America
results.brief_description: Examines the typical animal forms of the rain forest of Latin America against the four distinctive backgrounds created by the structure of dominant trees and plants. Illustrates how the forest functions at four levels, and examines the animals and plant community at each level. Shows camouflage, method of climbing and leaping, and the search for food as animals fulfil their part in the ecology of a specific layer of forest community. Introduces the complex ecology of rain forests from southern Mexico to the Amazon basin. Shows the four distinct communities of the four vegetation levels from highest trees to small plants, with their characteristic birds, mammals, reptiles, amphibians, insects and other invertebrates and epiphytic plants.

results.title: Wildlife in the dry
results.creator_credit: Motif Film Productions and Ronald Turner
results.brief_description: A study of the principal birds of the Northern Territory during the dry season: brolgas, ibis, ducks, finches, parrots, egrets, geese and cormorants. Other wildlife of the region - crocodiles and buffaloes are also shown.

results.title: Wildflowers of Australia: Flowers and Their Habitats
results.creator_credit: EVP Television, Ross Wurst and Joyce Haynes
results.brief_description: A video panorama of native flora from the wetlands, woodlands, grasslands, arid and coastal heathlands of Australia. The wildflowers presented in this video have been filmed on location across Australia, over a period of many years, and in many cases have been difficult to identify.

results.title: Wildfire
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Corporation, Victoria. Forests Commission and Dione Gilmour
results.brief_description: Bushfires, an annual hazard in Australia, destroy many thousands of hectares of bushland each year. This film traces the progress of a fire from start to finish though the eyes of the men who fight the fires and those who plan firefighting strategy. Also examines the controversy surrounding the claim that fire is necessary for the survival of the bush. Suitable for middle and upper primary and secondary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Australian Broadcasting Corporation, Victoria. Forests Commission and Dione Gilmour

results.title: Wildest Antarctica
results.creator_credit: Grainger Television Australia and Greg Grainger
results.brief_description: Using footage shot during five expeditions, Wildest Antarctica stunningly documents the fragile beauty of this extraordinary continent. Despite increased awareness of the environment in recent years, Antarctica and its inhabitants are still under threat from the effects of global warming. This documentary examines the current state of the continent, and examines the day-to-day lives of the wild creatures that roam its vast expanse. Penguin breeds discussed in detail include Adelie, Chinstrap, Gentoo, Emperor, Royal, Rockhopper, and Magellanic. Seals, whales, dolphins, and sea birds, and their fight for survival against pollution and predation, are also documented.
